summary: A message from the Intersect Committee in Buddhism of Vitnam, conveying condolences to Mr. Dean Rusk, the Secretary of State, following President Kennedy's assassination.
summary_one_paragraph: On November 23, 1963, a message originating from USN-27 and addressed to DIRNSA relays condolences from the Intersect Committee in Buddhism of Vitnam to Secretary of State Dean Rusk, expressing sorrow over the assassination of President John Kennedy. The message includes sentiments from Rev. Thich Tam Chau, Chairman of the Intersect Committee, and acknowledges the grief felt by the US Government.
title: Condolences on Mr. Deakrsk, Secretary of State
